DataElement.preferredName: Nodule Greater Than or Equal To 3 Centimeter Present Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to whether or not a nodule greater than or equal to 3 cm was present.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Nodule Greater Than or Equal To 3 Centimeter Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A small lump, swelling or collection of tissue._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one._A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A small lump, swelling or collection of tissue.

Property.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Three Centimeter Present
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.:A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.
